intro: Scutellaria mellichampii, commonly known as Mellichamp's skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
